channel.title: Parallelizing on STAT-5526 Fall 2020
channel.description: Recent content in Parallelizing on STAT-5526 Fall 2020

item.title: Lecture 1D - Going Parallel - Work In Process
item.description: Reasons why your compute can be taking too long Ok, the point to today’s discussion. Your project has exceeded what you can do locally. Possible reasons why: memory limits storage limits compute time is too long For most workstations, 16-48 GB of RAM and a few TB’s of local disk is about the practical limit. Most HPC clusters have nodes with much more RAM and networked parallel storage.
